description.narrative: Contribute to the Bureaus development policy advisory functions providing management support in Istanbul representing UNDP at the Istanbul International Center for Private Sector Development.

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1.1 Support on G20 1.2 A Global SDG incubator 1.3 Business Plus 1.4 Expanding the Role of PS in urbanization through Inclusive Business models
2.1 Toolkits on gender mainstreaming in skills development and on Extractive Industries 2.2 HP Foundation – IICPSD Entrepreneurial Skills Development Initiative 2.3 Technical advisory service to UNDP Cos 3.1 Two researches to be conducted and launched. 3.2 Introduction of the Green Sukuk initiative 3.3 Expanding the GIFIIP network base

comment.narrative:
PS strategies are aligned with the SDG’s and Enabling environment for inclusive business is created
The role of Private Sector in skills development is improved and increased
Private Capital is mobilized for the SDGs- Impact Investment embraced in Islamic Finance
Resilience among MSMEs is improved and private sector and foundations are better engaged in crisis response
,

- Training Programme “Municipal Enterprises for Local Authorities” will be conducted in cooperation with UN Habitat and UNDP Inclusive Growth Team - Research on The Role of Municipal Enterprises for Immediate Local Response to COVID19 - Technical Assistance on Establishing and Building Local Capacity in Production of Personal Protection Equipment (PPEs) through South-South Cooperation in Partnership with Uluslararası Sağlık A.Ş (USHAŞ) - IICPSD will propagate Solar Solutions in Africa through Private Sector Engagement through its South-South Cooperation portfolio. - IICPSD will lead the research “Medical Waste Ecosystem in Turkey: Lessons learnt during COVID-19”. - World Urban Forum 10, 8-13 February 2020 - Training Program on Municipal Enterprises for Local Authorities in Turkey, September, 2020. - Training Program on Municipal Enterprises for Local Authorities in Palestine, October, 2020. - IICPSD will continue working with UN Habitat, UCLG and CEEP through its South-South Cooperation portfolio. - “Integrating the Labour Force to 3D Design and Printing Value-Chain” study - “Prefeasibility study on ‘Innovative Skills Development Financing in India’” study - “Entrepreneurship in Africa and the Promises of the Key Sectors” study - Technical support to UNDP India on innovative skills development financing - Technical support to UNDP Africa’s YouthConnekt initiative on skills development and entrepreneurship development - Provide technical support for cutting-edge technologies such as AI and ML for digital development solutions to UNDP offices and development stakeholders - Advance mainstreaming digital transformation in the private sector and development space through skilling, upskilling and reskilling - Operationalize IICPSD-EBRD joint initiative multi-stakeholder advisory network ‘Skills for an Inclusive Future’ and launch during UNGA - Roll out IICPSD-UNV “Digital Transformation through Volunteerism” initiative - Provide digital development solution, research and advisory through SDG AI Lab initiative - Enhance the joint the ‘Entrepreneurial Skills Development Initiative for SDGs’ with the HP Foundation through global training of trainers and global capacity building program - Support digital transformation and Industry 4.0 skills of chambers in OIC member states together with ICCIA, in coordination with SESRIC - Continue working in collaboration with UNDP India, KOIS Invest, and NSDC to advance innovative financing strategies and tools for India’s skills development process - Support the activities of SDG Impact Accelerator (SDGia) which will initiate a partnership with the UN Technology Bank for technology transfer to the LDCs, support new calls on health-tech and financial inclusion, and engage impact investors to direct resources to SDGia - Replicate the impact investing ecosystem study in other countries (Morocco, Ukraine, Kazakhstan) - Generate knowledge products on impact investing - Islamic Finance and Impact Investing Training will be replicated in other countries: Morocco (completed) and Kazakhstan (tbc) - Develop Massive online open Course for Islamic Finance - SDG Investors Map Turkey: Mapping of investment opportunities in Turkey aligned with the SDGS - Green Sukuk Initiative is planned to be replicated in other countries: Morocco (tbc), Jordan (tbc) and Uzbekistan. Turkish companies (Palgaz and Tarım Kredi) supported for potential Green Sukuk issuances - A fund for impact investing in Turkey planned to be established in collaboration with the Turkish Ministry of Treasury and Finance capitalizing on the grant to be provided by the Joint SDG Fund if our proposal is selected. - Massive Online Open Course for Islamic Finance in Development - Green Sukuk for Africa Program - Stakeholder consultation workshop in Istanbul - Impact Investor Mapping for the Central African Region for Central African Forest Initiative (CAFI) - High Level Events: 75th UNGA 2020 - Convenings to disseminate GIFIIP’s work and raise awareness - GIFIIP website will be advanced and expanded to a broader audience - IICPSD will continue to expand GIFIIP’s network

-3 Country Offices served through COVID-19 response service offer: Kazakhstan, Vietnam and Azerbaijan -1 Country served through capacity building activities: Turkey. - 2 Publication: Guideline on local personal protection equipment and Medical Waste Ecosystem in Turkey. - Technical Assistance Services Offered: i) Local Personal Protection Equipment Production; ii) Medical Waste Ecosystem Analysis to identify bottlenecks and risks - Green Sukuk as a financial Instruments for Municipal Infrastructure - Training Program on Municipal Enterprises for Local Authorities (On average, 20 stakeholders are estimated to have been reached). - Survey on identifying bottlenecks and risks on Medical Waste Ecosystem (35 stakeholders were reached) - 3 UNDP Units are served through research and products (UNDP India, UNDP Africa, UNDP Nature Environment Energy Cluster) under Skills Development portfolio - 5 UNDP Units are served through technical assistance and capacity building activities carried out under Skills Development thematic area (UNDP India, UNDP São Tomé and Príncipe, UNDP BiH, UNDP Africa, UNDP Nature Environment Energy Cluster ) -3 Global Multi-stakeholder initiatives are developed (Skills for an Inclusive Future, UNV IICPSD IICPSD-UNV “Digital Transformation through Volunteerism” , HP Life Global Support Programme). - 5 Technical Assistance Services are offered on skills development and digital transformation - 3 Global Multi-stakeholder initiatives are developed and prepared for implementation: Skills for an Inclusive Future, UNV IICPSD IICPSD-UNV “Digital Transformation through Volunteerism”, HP Life Global Support Programme - 6 events and capacity building seminars are planned to be conducted or supported under the Skills development portfolio, outreaching over 300 stakeholders through these events. - 5 new partnership leads targeted to be reached through advocacy activities or one-on-one engagements. - 4 Country Offices served through knowledge products (Turkey, Morocco, Ukraine, Uzbekistan) by Impact Investing portfolio -1 Country served through capacity building activities (Morocco) by Impact Investing portfolio -3 Countries served with technical assistance (Uzbekistan, Ukraine, Pakistan) by Impact Investing portfolio. - 4 publications and/or knowledge products: (SDG Investor Map Turkey, Morocco and Ukraine Ecosystem Studies, Uzbekistan Green Sukuk Report) - 2 Technical Assistance Services Offered for Conventional Impact Investing (Joint SDG Fund Turkey Application, Ukraine-Impact Investing Platform) -2 Technical Assistance Services Offered for Islamic Finance and Impact Investing (Uzbekistan and Pakistan-Green Sukuk) - 5 Impact Investing Events and Capacity Building Seminars Conducted or Supported (Islamic Finance Training-Morocco, SDG Investor Map Launch, 75th UNGA Side Event, Morocco Ecosystem Study Launch, Ukraine Ecosystem Study Launch). On average, 80-100 stakeholders were reached per event. - CBi supported 14 business networks in Africa, Asia and Europe (Number of global, regional and online events organized: Global: 2, Regional: 0, Online: 8) - Under resilience and crisis response thematic area, one guidance note on gender has been developed. - Specific resources on preparedness, response and (early) recovery, coordination and communication, funding, EOC, localization, HDP collaboration were provided. - Improved network foundation - Training package on man-made disasters and two case studies. - CBi has 14 networks (supported 6 private sector networks and 3 networks for advancing in tier system) - Percentage of CBi Member Networks participating in relevant disaster management structures: 70% - Percentage of CBi Member Networks measuring the impact of their activities on the affected populations: 65%

1.1 Support on G20 1.2 A Global SDG incubator 1.3 Business Plus 1.4 Expanding the Role of PS in urbanization through Inclusive Business models
2.1 Toolkits on gender mainstreaming in skills development and on Extractive Industries 2.2 HP Foundation – IICPSD Entrepreneurial Skills Development Initiative 2.3 Technical advisory service to UNDP Cos 3.1 Two researches to be conducted and launched. 3.2 Introduction of the Green Sukuk initiative 3.3 Expanding the GIFIIP network base 3.4 Advocacy and promotion of Islamic finance impact Investing 4.1 Engage new CBi Member Networks 4.2 Increase global portal users 4.3 Develop next guidance tools for complex emergencies

Contributed to the establishment of Finance Sector Hub which offers support to governments to scale up Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) financing and to align public and private capital with the SDGs The Center, together with the UNDP’s Istanbul Regional Hub and Turkey Country Office, worked on a feasibility plan on the request of the Turkish Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MoFA), which is funded jointly by UNDP and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. SDGia was brought to life through a collaboration between MoFA, UNDP, World Food Programme, Bill&Melinda Gates Foundation, Limak Holding and Eczacıbaşı Holding. SDGia opened two calls on “Digital ID” and “Sanitation”, which received many applications around the world. In 2019, the graduates of the Accelerator presented their solutions at a side event organized by the Turkish government in collaboration with IICPSD during the 74th UNGA, which hosted leaders from public and private sectors including the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Turkey. Implemented and published Business+ in Brazil and “Engaging the Private Sector for Inclusive Urbanization” report to analyze the private sector engagement in inclusive business models. - Under the urbanization portfolio, IICPSD continues its support on the role of the private sector for providing inclusive urban services in particularly enabling an ecosystem to harness the role of private sector for building sustainable resilient and inclusive cities. - IICPSD initiated an evidence-based research on the Private Sector led good practices of Integrated Waste Management. The research aims to identify good practices which are suitable for replication and scaling up in emerging markets. - The Center continued its effort to expand its knowledge deposit on the global good practices by outreaching new institutions, such as European Centre of Employers and Enterprises providing Public Services (CEEP) and identified new models. - The Center supported World Cities Congress 2019 Istanbul. As part of its partnership with Istanbul Metropolitan Municipality, IICPSD took part at the Smart for Sustainability Panel in the World Cities Congress Istanbul in March 2019. - IICPSD supported UN Economic and Social Commission Asia and Pacific Urban Forum Report with the good practices from Turkey on private sector engagement in sustainable urban services. - IICPSD launched its publication “Engaging the Private Sector for Inclusive Urbanization: The Role of Municipally Owned Enterprises” in November 2019. - IICPSD will support World Urban Forum 10 in cooperation with UN Habitat to highlight private sector led good practices in inclusive urban service delivery. - IICPSD participated in Istanbul 3rd Economic Forum during the “Climate Change and the Cities” panel. IICPSD contributed to the organization of a high-level side event on the margins of 74th UN General Assembly titled “Private Sector Engagement in Innovative Solutions for Achieving he SDGs” on the 23rd September 2019. The event was hosted by H.E. Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Turkey and Mr. Mourad Wahba, UNDP Associate Administrator UNDP IICPSD and UNDP India published the ‘Gender Mainstreaming in Skills Development: Guidance Paper and Tools’ in October 2019. - UNDP IICPSD and HP Foundation organized an HP Life Training of Trainers at YouthConnekt Africa Summit in October in Kigali, Rwanda to support youth entrepreneurship, as a part of the activities of their joint initiative ‘Entrepreneurial Skills Development Initiative for the SDGs’. - UNDP IICPSD supports HP to develop new partnerships in India and in Turkey. HP partnered with ERTEV and lunched the Maker Karavan initiative in Bursa. - Organized a discussion on private sector engagement in South-South cooperation at BAPA+40 Conference with TIKA SESRIC, and UNOSSC . Initiated a partnership with EBRD to create a multi-stakeholder a+I14dvisory network titled ‘Skills for Inclusive Future’ to support skills development for digital transformation. Organized a workshop titled ‘Digital Skills Development in OIC countries’ with SESRIC funded by COMCEC. Launched the private sector led Vocational Training Center in Gradačac together with TIKA and UNDP Bosnia and Herzegovina. Initiated a global partnership with UNV to support digital transformation through volunteerism. the Center conducted a pre-assessment study on the current Green Sukuk ecosystem in Pakistan Under the Green Sukuk Initiative launched in partnership with Securities Commission Malaysia and IsDB’s ICD and IFSD, the Center conducted a pre-assessment study on the current Green Sukuk ecosystem in Pakistan and organized a validation workshop in collaboration with UNDP Pakistan County Office to present the findings and to agree on the next steps. As part of GIFIIP’s Green Sukuk Initiative, IICPSD started a dialogue with the African Development Bank (AfDB) and IsDB to jointly set-up the Shariah-compliant Green Sukuk for Africa Fund aiming at developing the green energy infrastructure in the continent leveraging the GCF funding with a blended finance approach.
Islamic Finance and Impact Investing Training Programme was organized on 10-11 July 2019 in Indonesia, Jakarta.
Connecting Business initiative (CBi) published their 2018 progress report, held its Annual meeting, two Executive Committee meetings and 4 webinars. With funding from the European Union Civil Protection Humanitarian Aid or ECHO, CBi and the Overseas Development Institute (ODI) co-developed a resource for private sector networks operating in manmade disaster contexts: Engaging companies in manmade disasters - a guidance toolkit for private sector networks.

- Three training programmes on Municipal Enterprises for Local Authorities are planned to be conducted under the South-South Cooperation portfolio. - Survey on identifying bottlenecks and risks on Medical Waste Ecosystem (Over 50 stakeholders are expected to be reached - Two technical assistance services on local PPE production services are planned to be delivered. - One technical assistance on establishing municipal enterprise is planned to be delivered - One Green Sukuk transaction for Municipal project is targeted to be supported - Two publications and or knowledge products are planned to be carried out under South-South Cooperation thematic area. - Medical Waste Ecosystem in Central Asia are planned to be carried out. - Financing Sustainable Solid Waste Management: through Green Sukuk are planned to be carried out. - Six events and capacity building seminars are planned to be conducted or supported under Skills Development portfolio, reaching over 500 stakeholders through these events. - Over 20 new partnership leads targeted to be reached through advocacy activities or one-on-one engagements under skills development portfolio. - Eight technical assistance services are offered on skills development and digital transformation. - Eight publications and/or knowledge and advisory products and services are planned under Skills for an Inclusive Future, UNV IICPSD IICPSD-UNV “Digital Transformation through Volunteerism” & SDG AI Lab, HP LIFE Global Support Programme. - Six impact investing events and capacity building seminars are planned to be conducted or supported, outreaching over 500 stakeholders through these events. - Over 50 impact creating enterprises and 50 responsible/ impact investors are targeted to be reached through advocacy activities or one-on-one interviews. - IICPSD plans to develop five technical assistance services under Impact Investing portfolio. - IICPSD plans to support impact investing or Green Sukuk transaction - Four publications and or knowledge products including SDG Investor Maps are planned to be developed under Impact Investing portfolio. IICPSD’s impact investing focus will be more geared towards implementation of these research outputs through technical assistance services.

IICPSD Implemented its activities under four thematic areas 1 - Private Sector Engagement through South-South Cooperation for the SDGs; 2 - Private Sector Engagement in Digital Transformation and Skills Development; 3 - Impact Investing; 4 - Resilience and Crisis Response. To engage the private sector through South-South Cooperation for the SDGs IICPSD organized a training programme on Municipal Enterprise for Local Authorities for the local authorities of Azerbaijan and Albania and a training programme on Inclusive and Sustainable Waste Management in Turkey A Country based survey on Solid Waste Management Ecosystem has been conducted in Uruguay, Tunisia, Argentina through International Solid Waste Association National Committees. The country-based survey will be conducted in 10 target countries in the first quarter of 2022. IICPSD released two publications Lessons Learnt and Strategies for Local Manufacturing of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) for COVID 19 Response Based on Literature Review, Experience and Case Study from Turkey USHAS. and Medical Waste Ecosystem in Turkey . Under digital transformation and skills in 2021, jointly with EBRD, IICPSD launched Skills for an Inclusive Future Network within the margins of the High-Level Political Forum. S4IF is onboarding the initial cohort of private sector members and began work on a Country Chapter in collaboration with UNDP Turkey CO. Under SDG AI Lab, IICPSD provides research, development and advisory support through cutting-edge digital solutions in harnessing the potential of Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML) and GIS for sustainable development. Moreover, the Lab is actively engaging online volunteers into SDGs related digital projects through its Volunteer Data Scientists initiative. Under the partnership with HP Foundation, IICPSD conducted seven capacity development trainings in Egypt for the academic staff of four academic institutions. Moreover, IICPSD partnered with YouthConnekt Africa (YCA) to enhance 21st century and entrepreneurial skills development in Africa. Under this collaboration, IICPSD and YCA agreed on a multi-year workplan to implement capacity development activities. In 2021, IICPSD has expanded its impact investing services both in developing and developed countries. The center has published The SDG Investor Map Turkey . The map was lunched in a High-Level Policy Dialogue event during the 11th Bosphorus Summit in March 2021 with the participation of the President of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdoğan and UNDP Administrator Achim Steiner as keynote speakers. In addition to the SDG Investor Maps in Turkey, and Ukraine. The center supported 9 Countries for the SDG Investor Maps in South Africa, Kenya, Nigeria and Rwanda and ecosystem studies and SDG Investor Maps in Tunisia, Morocco, Djibouti, Eswatini and Mauritius. IICPSD contributed to the Green Sukuk Initiative in Uzbekistan with an assessment report. IICPSD prepared Djibouti Islamic Microfinance Assessment and Strategy Development and Engaging Islamic Finance Modalities with Djibouti Partial Credit Guarantee Fund. The center also delivered the policy brief on “The Afghan Banking and Financial System- Status and Options to avoid Collapse” which received high interest in international media. The FSH team, under the leadership of the Istanbul Center, and in partnership with the NCE team provided technical assistance through the GPN on the SDG Joint Fund Component 2 proposals on SDG Financing. UNDP is the first ranked organization participating in 7 out of 9 top ranking Joint Programmes and is lead in 5 (with participation of UNCDF as a key partner in 3) out of the 9 programmes out of 155 projects submitted.
In the first round
1) Fiji-- Investing in Coral Reefs and the Blue Economy Indonesia, Blue Economy, UNDP (lead), UNCDF, UNEP 2) Indonesia- Driving Public and Private Capital Towards Green and Social Investments in Indonesia, People & Health, Natural Ecosystems & Climate Action, UNDP (lead), UNEP, UNICEF, UNIDO 3) Malawi — develop the window under the BUILD fund, Agriculture & Food Security, UNDP (lead), UNCDF, FAO 4) Uruguay-- Innovative Finance for Clean Tech Solutions in Uruguays Renewable Energy Sector: The Renewable Energy Innovation Fund, Resilient Infrastructure, UNIDO (lead), UNDP, UN WOMEN In the second round 5) Madagascar Transforming the Financial System to Support the Development of Sustainable Energy Solutions UNDP lead UNCDF, UNIDO 6) Northern Macedonia Green Finance Facility to Improve Air Quality and Combat Climate Change in North Macedonia (UNDP lead) IOM , UNECE 7) Zimbabwe Catalysing Investment into Renewable Energy for the Acceleration of the Attainment of the Sustainable Development Goals in Zimbabwe
